title: HELP!! PVP.Net Patcher kernal has stopped working!
body: I tried opening League and a window pops up saying "pvp.net patcher kernel has stopped working" (before patcher) then it give me the choice to only close program. Now I don't know what to do. I tried deleting "rads_user_kernel.exe" but didn't help. PLSSS HELP

replies.body:
try opening lol  as an administrator.
if that doesnt work, try this:
Go into your League of Legends folder in C:/Riot Games
Open up the "RADS" folder.
Open up the "Projects" folder.
Open up the "lol_air_client" folder.
Open up the "releases" folder.
Open up the folder that's in there. It changes every patch, but contains the same stuff.
Delete the two files named "S_OK" and "release manifest"
Open up the "deploy" folder.
Delete the "logs", "META-INF", "lol.properties", and "LoLClient.exe"
Restart your Patcher.
It will repatch the recent patch you had just downloaded.
You probably mean the folder with the latest version number when you reach "releases".
nope, theres 2 files and a folder in the releases folder. delete the 2 files

That doesn't match up.

In the directory "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases" (if using default path) there are folders for every version of League which you've patched on that system. They are numbered ascendingly, and there can exist an infinite amount of folders there.

Inside those numbered folders you would find the files "S_OK" and "release manifest", if they exist.

What are you seeing exactly when you go to "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases"?

Idk whats different about ur files, but these r mine
p.s. sorry for late reply, no wifi yet. Moved houses
anyways, forget about this; thread starter doesnt care or solved his problem :D

Yo I said "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases" not "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\0.0.1.140". When I navigate there, I see a bunch of folders.

I cannot upload images due to limitations of my browser.

That's a very well organised explorer, by the way.

And who cares about the OP anyway?
currently not on my mac pro so i cant answer ur question. but if i recall correctly, the only folder in it is the '0.0.1.140'. i think. yh, only that folder :P. anyways, why is this important lol

No idea.

Absolutely no idea.

But it was insightful; I'll keep this in mind when assisting others. Thank you.

Hi there. If you guys are looking for a real solution please check this one:

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/fTGsdZLk-solution-for-patcher-kernel

Why would you think deleting an executable file would work? Are you still able to run the patcher at all?

You might have to do a full reinstall if you can't.
